ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned techniques of the west African dance style, I learned about rhythm, and how to write about this type of dance. I also learned about the history of west African dance.

Dance as a communal activity 
Dance as a representation of the various big moments moments in life
Dance being a way to walk or reach something
I learned the basics of West African dance. I learned how to use weight and space in dance movements.

Several techniques within African dance, including weight management, sitting when dancing, maintaining pace, and listening to the rhythm of any African beat. Moreover, I learnt about the social importance of dancing and promoting collaboration.
I not only learned how to dance African dance but also about its foundational elements and cultural significance in African community and society.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Sometimes it was unclear about what readings we needed to do for each class, or when our writing assignments were due. I would suggest using canvas to show critical due dates/submissions.
The dances were taught at a really digestible pace, so we could learn together, ask questions, and improve along the way.
It would have preferred to make a video detailing our experience in the class rather than writing a paper.

This course had many strengths. The instructor was very engaging and gave us feedback to improve.  I enjoyed seeing how all of the work we did throughout the semester came together in the end in our final performance.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes I would recommend this class to students who are looking for a low workload course AND to those who like to dance, or are willing to learn/spend a lot of time dancing.

Yes! This was a very fun course. Was a great way to exercise and learn about dance. The readings are king but you can skim through honestly. This class is open to engage, even if you dont agree with the material your thoughts are welcomed

Yes! I had a great time with Prof. Coulibaly and with my classmates. It was a stress-free environment where you could just put aside your worries for 2 hours and learn new dances. The workload is pretty low, which allows you the mental capacity to really enjoy the class and learn about West African culture. It was an immersive experience and a great class for a senior.
Totally recommend it. If you're looking for a class without lots of reading and writing but still learning something new, take this class. Coulibaly is a great professor.
Yes, this course was excellent, engaging, and I learned a lot about African dance, rhythm, and culture.
